name: Yo Mama's Big Fat Booty Band
Jelly Ellington
concise_bio: Asheville-born, Austin-raised rocker Jelly Ellington fuses Appalachian grit with Texas blues fire, delivering guitar-forward roots rock with swagger.
detailed_bio: Ellington is an American guitarist and singer-songwriter whose sound merges Texas blues, Southern rock, and Appalachian roots. Raised in Asheville and hardened in Austin's legendary blues scene, Jelly's electrifying live performances and soulful vocals have earned him Top 10 placements in the Austin Music Awards for Best Guitarist. His blend of fiery, blues-centric rock—shaped by classical training and relentless stage work—has led to collaborations with Grammy-winning musicians and iconic Texas artists. His latest release, the blistering live EP 'Live at Antone's,' captures his dynamic presence at Austin's Home of the Blues.

name: Floating Action
specific_genre: Indie Groove Pop with Global Flair
concise_bio: Floating Action is Seth Kauffman's shape-shifting project blending indie pop, R&B, dub, and world rhythms into warm, hypnotic soundscapes.
detailed_bio: Floating Action is the long-running musical vessel of Asheville multi-instrumentalist Seth Kauffman. Known for recording nearly all instrumentation himself, Kauffman crafts genre-blurring indie pop steeped in dub grooves, soul textures, world rhythms, and sun-soaked melodies. His catalog—released across respected indie labels like Park the Van, Removador, and New West—has earned him a reputation as a 'musician's musician,' leading to collaborations with Jim James, Dan Auerbach, Lana Del Rey, Ray LaMontagne, and more. Floating Action's records are praised for their warm, lo-fi glow and inventive blending of global influences.

name: Tyler Ramsey
concise_bio: Former Band of Horses guitarist Tyler Ramsey creates cinematic indie folk-rock built on fingerpicked guitar, warm textures, and deeply emotional songwriting.
detailed_bio: Tyler Ramsey is an Asheville-area singer-songwriter and guitarist acclaimed for his atmospheric blend of modern folk, indie rock, and Americana. Best known as a former member of Band of Horses, Ramsey contributed songwriting and guitar work across three studio albums. His solo work showcases intricate guitar lines, vivid storytelling, and lush arrangements, most notably on 2019's 'For the Morning' and his newest album 'New Lost Ages,' produced by Phil Ek (Fleet Foxes, Father John Misty). Featuring collaborators from Fleet Foxes and My Morning Jacket, his music balances intimacy with expansive, cinematic soundscapes.

name: Hustle Souls
concise_bio: Hustle Souls blend retro-soul warmth, brass-band funk, and modern Americana into high-energy, harmony-driven performances.
detailed_bio: Hustle Souls is an Asheville-based band merging vintage soul, brass-band funk, and singer-songwriter Americana. Powered by roaring Hammond B3 organ, jubilant horn lines, and three-part vocal harmonies, the group has been praised for its vibrant, generation-bridging sound. Named one of Music Connection Magazine's Hot 100 Unsigned Artists, Hustle Souls have appeared at major festivals and shared stages with artists like Dumpstaphunk and Kofi Burbridge. Their 2024 vinyl debut and NAMM Show performances further cemented their status as one of the Southeast's most exciting modern soul-funk bands.

name: Electro Lust
concise_bio: An Asheville supergroup fusing electronic production with live brass, funk, Latin, Cuban, and Afrobeat influences into club-ready dance anthems.
detailed_bio: Electro Lust is a high-voltage electro-funk supergroup made up of Grammy-winning members of Yo Mama's Big Fat Booty Band, The Fritz, and Empire Strikes Brass. Their sound blends punchy electronic beats with live trombone, trumpet, sax, keys, guitar, and drums—creating a kaleidoscopic mix of funk, Latin, Cuban, and Afrobeat textures. Their shows feel like a midnight Miami club colliding with a Brazilian street party and a Havana jam session, stitched together with hip-hop swagger and festival-grade energy.

name: Snake Oil Medicine Show
concise_bio: Snake Oil Medicine Show mixes psychedelic world rhythms, funk, bluegrass, and visual art into a technicolor performance spectacle.
detailed_bio: Snake Oil Medicine Show is a long-running Asheville collective blending world music, psychedelic funk, bluegrass, jazz, and improvisational art into a vibrant, circus-like live experience. Known for live painting, bold costumes, genre-hopping jams, and kaleidoscopic energy, their shows feel like a Mardi Gras parade fused with a street festival and a psychedelic hoedown. Their cross-cultural musical approach and theatrical flair have made them a beloved Asheville institution.

name: Caitlin Krisko & The Broadcast
concise_bio: A thunderous soul-rock band led by powerhouse vocalist Caitlin Krisko, blending blues grit, psychedelic rock, and soaring emotional intensity.
detailed_bio: Caitlin Krisko & The Broadcast is a soul-rock juggernaut from Asheville known for explosive vocals, blues-rock swagger, and psychedelic-soaked arrangements. Formed in 2021, the group's electrifying performances led Krisko to collaborate with members of Tedeschi Trucks Band and David Bowie's Blackstar Band on their album 'Lost My Sight.' Their soulful yet muscular sound has placed them on stages with Mavis Staples, St. Paul & the Broken Bones, Marcus King, Charles Bradley, and more, establishing them as one of the Southeast's most commanding live bands.

name: The Dolltones
concise_bio: The Dolltones smash together emo heart, alt-rock grit, shoegaze haze, and psychedelic horns into Asheville's signature 'bluegaze' sound.
detailed_bio: Founded in 2024, The Dolltones are an Asheville rock collective blending emo, distortion-soaked alt-rock, and shoegaze textures with unexpected bursts of brass. Their signature 'bluegaze' sound pairs tear-jerker melodies with heavy guitars and swirling atmospheres, appealing to fans of '90s alternative and '00s emo revival. Their debut album 'Never Ever Somewhere' and early singles quickly cemented them as a standout emerging act in Asheville's alternative scene.

name: Sugar Bomb
concise_bio: Sugar Bomb is an Asheville jazz-fusion trio exploding with improvisation, deep-pocket grooves, and high-energy instrumental storytelling.
detailed_bio: Sugar Bomb is a dynamic Asheville trio known for mind-bending instrumental fusion that blends jazz, groove, hip-hop, and improvisational experimentation. With Jacob Bruner on keys, Eli Kahn on guitar/bass, and Joe Enright on drums, the band delivers explosive live shows filled with shifting textures, extended jams, and infectious rhythms. Their rapidly growing reputation in the fusion scene is fueled by their extreme dynamic range and bold, melodic exploration.

name: The Welcoming
concise_bio: The Welcoming blends big riffs, soaring vocals, and progressive-metal edge to create melodic, high-impact modern rock.
detailed_bio: The Welcoming is an Asheville rock/metal hybrid project that blurs the line between melodic rock, progressive metal, and atmospheric alternative. Originally the solo vision of James Ferrell, the band has evolved into a full live unit crafting songs packed with technical precision, emotional urgency, and massive vocal hooks. With influences ranging from Thrice and Cave In to A Perfect Circle, The Welcoming delivers dynamic, cinematic rock and metal built for fans who want riffs and melody in equal measure.
